snippet: Hundreds of tourists and residents across Colorado eagerly took part in the country’s first-ever sales of state-regulated recreational marijuana.
abstract: Hundreds of tourists and residents across Colorado eagerly take part in country’s first-ever sales of state-regulated recreational marijuana; supporters hail change as historic departure from drug laws focused on punishment and prohibition; to skeptics, it represents grand folly that they predict will tarnish state's image and lead to higher teenage drug use and more impaired driving.

byline.contributor: Kirk Johnson contributed reporting from Seattle.

lead_paragraph: Hundreds of tourists and residents across Colorado eagerly took part in the country’s first-ever sales of state-regulated recreational marijuana.

headline.main: Up Early and in Line for a Marijuana Milestone in Colorado
headline.print_headline: In Line Early for Milestone on Marijuana
